H0.text: Ocean trenches form when magma emerges between two diverging oceanic plates.

H1.text: Fault boundaries are the features that form when magma emerges between two diverging oceanic plates.

H2.text: Midâ€‘ocean ridges are the features that form when magma emerges between two diverging oceanic plates.

H3.text: Composite volcanoes form when magma emerges between two diverging oceanic plates.

A4.text: The melt rises as magma at the linear weakness between the separating plates, and emerges as lava, creating new oceanic crust and lithosphere upon cooling.

A5.text: New magma of basalt composition emerges at and near the axis because of decompression melting in the underlying Earth's mantle.
